text: Bomber, 2016 vintage. Wonderful boozy dark fruit aroma with notes of caramel, toffee, vanilla, bourbon and oak. Pours deep caramel brown with a very thin light brown head that has no retention or lacing. Starts with rich booze soaked dark fruit flavors with nice notes of vanilla and bourbon that also has a rich, full body and nice smooth mouthfeel. Finishes smooth and boozy with delightful caramel and toffee flavors with a bit of oak and warming alcohol. A nice winter beer, but so good I wouldnt mind it anytime!

This beer is extremely amazing. Very surprising for Pelican but they knocked out of the park on this one. Cheers!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 2015 vintage held in the cellar for just about one year. Dark brown pour with a finger of creamy tan head. Powerful aroma centered around the barrel treatment; bourbon, vanilla, caramel, and hints of hops. The flavor is truly terrific and one of the best barreled barley wines I can recall to date lots of barrel influence without being overly hot or too firm in center stage. Big bourbon sweetness, vanilla, caramel, dark fruits, a little wood, and just enough hops. Ive heard that this can be pretty hot when fresh; I can only attest to a bottle with a year of age on it; fantastic stuff.

Pours a opaque with a thick small khaki head and great lacing. 
Smell is of dark chocolate, espresso, and vanilla. 
Taste is creamy, strong, dark chocolate, licorice, vanilla, bourbon, and roasted malt.

On tap at Elizabeth Station. Vintage 2016. Pours an aopaque very dark brown with a dark beige head. Aroma and taste are dark fruits, bourbon, molasses, very sweet, some candies notes, slight sourness. One more loooong seeper. Great stuff.

Pours very dark brown, almost black with a low tan head. Aromas of muscovado sugar, roasted nuts, leather, caramel, oak, bourbon. Massive depth. Taste is roasted and caramel sweetness with bourbon character and syrupy notes. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with low carbonation.

Pours dark dark brown wirh minimal brown head
Aromas har lovely notes of bourbon, vanilla, caramel, muscavado, burned caramel, hints of dark fruits
Taste has notes caramel, bourbon, vanilla, muscavado, dark fruits, figs, dades, hints of liqourize, leather, tobacco
Mouthfeel is full bodied, sweet, low carbonation and medium bitter finish. Very nice!

On tap@:pours deep mahagony color, slighly clear, with tan off-white head, which transforms itself to a ring around the glass. Aroma-Flavor: intense malt profile, which takes on toasted toffee, caramel, hint of dark chocolate, dried fruits esters, hint of vanillin & gentle sherry-like note deep in the background. Finish is dry, slightly sticky, body is medium to full, texture is velvetly, carbonation is low. Alcohol is very well hidden.
Super tasty with small sips. Its a smorgusboard of complex flavors. At $9 a glass I better like it! On tap at Rogue Growler with Celina.

2014 and 2015, side by side. Big malt nose, raisins, caramel, booze, dried fruits galore, some orange. Great raisiny flavor with caramel and treacle. Silky and smooth, the 2014 was for me a step above the 15.

Bomber, 2014 vintage. Nose of strong sugary stone fruit and dark fruit, some barrel, along with alcohol fumes. Clear dark reddish/brown color. Super sweet, caramelly, vanilla, light bourbon, and some slightly tart dark fruit. Heavy body, very smooth and slick. Rich, ripe stuff. A bomb on the tongue.

Excelentes y complejos aromas. Destacan las notas dulces, el bourbon, grano, madera, nuez, algo de pasas y un toque licoroso similar al oporto.

Su color es negro con tonos granates, de cuerpo redondo y denso, carbonatacion baja y ligera corona de espuma de nula retención.

En Boca es suave, dulce, compleja, con notas a frutos secos y un final licoroso.

Al paladar es exquisita contemplando que se está a punto de beber. Los lupulos son inexistentes por el tiempo de guarda. Se desarrollaron notas a oporto. Se perciben fácilmente los sabores a pasas e higos, es densa, se encuentran el bourbon y la madera. Es sumamente maltosa y el final es pronunciado, largo, pleno de sabor y algo alcohólico, aun que definitivamente este último punto.muy bien integrado.

En general es muy buena. Disfrutada a cada sorbo y con ganas de dar el que sigue.

2016 bottle purchased at The Davis Beer Shoppe. The aroma is essentially dominated by sweetness, vanilla, and bourbon. There might be a touch of caramel present. I dont really smell the base beer in any way. The beer itself has a brownish-yellow head that is fairly strong, and a mahogany, slightly transparent body. If I didnt know any better, Id say this is a BA Impy Stout at this point. Starts with a sweet, sugary, sticky, caramel and toffee flavoring. A little buttery diacetyl is also present, but I think thats ok in a big English Barleywine. The middle has a little bit of bourbon and vanilla flavors, but the bourbon is surprisingly not over-done flavor-wise. This finishes with some leather and tobacco. Its a bit warming, and the ethanol is surprisingly well-hidden. The mouthfeel on this is just the right balance of carbonation to make this dangerously drinkable. This is decadent, and a little on the sweet side. Definitely something I would enjoy drinking 8oz of, but 22oz is going to be tough to drink solo.

2016 bottle. Bourbon, molasses, brown sugar, oak, and syrup dominate the aroma. This beer is quite pungent. The head is ever so wispy, and fades fast. Flavors are much the same, with the added warmth. The heat from the alcohol is pleasant, and soothes the body into complete relaxation. This is a beer, when consumed alone, brings you into the land of "Who Gives a Shit?". The texture is rich, and slick. Quite honestly, Ive quite had it with the barrel-aged trend, but Pelican has been brewing this beer prior to that trend, and theyre doing a damn good job with it. For me, the texture is hard to beet. Every year I can count on this being just as great as the previous year. Well done.

22oz bottle of 2015 release. Pours a dark brown color with a bit of head. Delicious malty bourbon aroma. Smooth malty flavor with good balance of bourbon. Alcohol well hidden. Was much hotter when newly released.

Bottle (2011 edition) @home, from my first trade with Richiesd in 2012, big thanks! Deep dark brown color. Beige head with short retention. Aromas boasting of bourbon, sweetness, vanilla, some dried fruit, alcohol, booze, caramel, perhaps a tiny bit oxydized. Retronasal its boozy/alcoholic, sweet, vanilla, bourbon. Flavor is rather sweet, sticky, alcoholic. Strong alcohol feel. Medium to full bodied. Long finish, slightly woody. Lovely stuff.
Shared at Craft. Poured hazy dark brownish with tan head. Nose was caramel malt, oaky bourbon, vanilla. Dense mouthfeel, with flavors of oaky bourbon, caramelly tannins, vanilla. Gets a bit hot late.

Poured into a snifter showing caramel brown rims and a dark center with no head. 

The nose shows dark notes of caramel. 

The palate is thick bodied with no carbonation. Barely any sweetness. Flavors of dry caramel and hints of smoke. Moderate hoppy bitterness.

Sample from 2015 bottle at the "Post Beer Week Bottle Share" on 06/06/16. The beer pours a very dark brown color with a hint of amber around the edges, and a medium beige head that diminishes gradually to a film. Patchy lacing on the glass. The aroma consists of bourbon, malt and dark fruits. Full-bodied with flavors of oaky bourbon, caramel malt, fig and vanilla. The finish is boozy with an oaky vanilla and malt aftertaste. Good beer all around.
Butelka. Aromat mocno rodzynkowy, karmelowy, sporo owoców, czekolady. Smak słodki, mocno owocowy, suszony, lekko palony, bardzo złożony. Pełne ciało, gęste. Piękne piwo.

July 28, 2015. Tasting at jtclockworks, thanks for sharing!
Dark brown with just a small tan ring around the edge. Aroma is sweet malty and slight boozy with caramel, raisins, figs, bourbon, prunes, resin, vanilla and notes of oak. Taste is sweet malty, light bitter and boozy. Finish is light bitterness with a roasted note, warming bourbon alcohol on top on a sweet malty base with sticky caramel, raisins, prunes, figs and vanilla. Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation. 
Nice!

2015 750ml bottle. Huge beer with an intense flavour palate worthy of joining the storm. Bourbon barrel aging brings out that fantastic sweet flavour with a solid alcohol backbone. Lots of Malty flavors with toffee and vanilla. Exceptional beer.

Black color. Dark tan head that collapses quickly into a thin collar. Freckled lacing. Very malty aroma. Chocolate, cherry, wood, vanilla, and alcohol pour out of the aroma. Some toffee notes also. Sticky texture. Starts off very fruity and finishes oakey and smokey. Heavy body. Average carbonation. Leaves a hangover film on the lips. Love this beer but i did not expect the harshness in it.

Refrigerated brown bottle, 2015, poured into snifter. Clear brown with no head. Aroma is nice caramel malt, medium body, no carbonation, and very little lacing. Taste is caramel malt, oak, some alcohol, and toffee.  Pretty good, but heavy.

This is review of 2013 vintage. Bottle is around 2 1/4 years old at this point. 

Pours an extremely dark brown, looks closer to an imperial stout than a barleywine. Head is very thin and mocha colored. Head retention was non existent and neither was lacing. 

Smell is big on caramel, burnt sugar, brandy soaked figs, vanilla, and oak. Bourbon is slightly present but blends nicely. No hops apparent, this is a malt bomb. 

Taste is very sweet and somewhat dry. Burnt caramel, bittersweet chocolate, vanilla, and slight oxidation are main flavors detected. As beer warms Im getting big hits of dried fruit, prune, fig, and dates. That along with some warming alcohol gives the beer a false sense of being aged in cognac barrels rather than bourbon. Maybe the prolonged aging is to blame for that. Hops are nowhere to be found, sweet malt and alcohol is the name of the game here. 

Mouthfeel is oily, dense, and somewhat undercarbonated. Alcohol is slightly astringent, head was never a factor unfortunately. 

Overall, beer was good, solid representation of the style. Just wish there was more head and a bit more carbonation. Maybe 2 years in the bottle have diminished some of the qualities that were present in 2014 when I had this beer at Gabf

Chez Alexandre. Merci à Éric pour le partage! Un liquide dont la robe pourpre est digne des Grands Alcools de ce monde. Foncé et clair comme du cristal, le liquide affiche une robe profondément pourpre aux nuances infinies. Ornage, pourpre, rouge, rubis, brique... Toutes les teintes sy trouvent. Aucune mousse en surface; ce liquide arbore toutes les teintes possibles que les grands Cognac peuvent présenter. Nez très alcoolisé par un vieillissement abusif en barriques de bourbon. Cest sucré, vanillé... décadent! Du caramel, toffee, sucre dorge et cassonade. Cest intense et il faut aimer. Jaime. En bouche le liquide manque à mon avis de subtilités. Cette fois cest le chocolat qui prend le dessus. Lalcool est bien sûr encore très présent. Une sensation plutôt déplaisante de sucre qui me râpe la gorge détourne mon attention des saveurs somme toutes douces auxquelles je ne peux accorder toute lattention quelles méritent. Aucune amertume, peu de bois, longueur moyenne, il faut être un minimum de 8 personnes pour partager cette bouteille.
Bottle shared at Gaucho. Pours a medium brown Amber color. Aromas of vanilla and candied dark fruits. Taste is sweet for sure but not cloying. Thick syrupy body. Low carbonation. Solid barleywine.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2016 Foiled bomber. 2015 bottle, 14% ABV. Aroma starts out pungent with strong bourbon notes, but it milds out pretty quickly, leaving a perfect smelling barrel-aged beer--coconut, vanilla, light wood, licorice, raisin, toffee, and some cheese. Pours a deep dark brown with one finger of tan foam that reduces after a minute. Taste is sweet and savory with all aroma deScriptors represented in flavor. I really dig the cheesiness. Kind of a curveball there. Body is full, mouthfeel damn near chewy. As good of a barrel-aged beer as Ive ever had I think, rivaling Firestone Walkers Anniversary beers. The only thing preventing a perfect score is a feeling of being slightly burned out on these types of beers lately. If I had rated this a year or two ago, it could have been a perfect score, I think.

Taste from chucks CD. Carmel and vanilla are well blended. A little carbonation on the back end. Nice!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From bomber. This is a 2013 bottle opened in January of 2016. Pours dark dark coppery brown with a very small orange-cream colored head. Huge aroma of caramel. Taste is very sweet with caramel and gingerbread, with a strong finish of biscuit. Full mouthfeel. Viscous. Very sweet and good, but I cant drink much of this. Its so rich.

2013 bottle. Dark amber brown, with a thin (almost non existent) head. Very sweet, sugary, some dark fruit, molasses, cardboard, light oak, and very light on the bourbon. Its not that old, but still noticeably oxidized. Unfortunately I am not liking this too much, its okay, but does not live up to the hype.

2014 bottle. Thanks Roger.
This was poured into a tulip, why, well, because I broke one of my snifters today and Im an asshole.
Heres the rest;
The appearance was a black color with a slim finger-ed filmy head that quickly dissipated to leave barely nothing for lacing.
The aroma makes up for lack of show in the aroma to allow a stellar amount of sweet caramel, light toffee, subtle tobacco, eloquent vanilla, sweet boozy/alcohol (almost bourbon-esque sort of underlying aroma).
The taste enables a sweet to glossy slide of the malts just riding all along my tongue in a sticky sort of sweet fashion. Definitely a sweet sticky aftertaste of the malts running into the finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body as its a good sipper. Carbonation runs extremely light but Im assuming thats because of the age of the bottle, so no worries.
Overall, English Barleywine, oh hell yeah! Definitely fits the style and am extremely glad I finally got to try this.
Almost black with a small white head. Aroma is rye, chocolate and bisquit. Taste is rye, caramel and bread.

Bottle shared with karstenborg at xmas night in Rauland, Norway. 2010 edition. Very dark brown body with a creamy tan head. Huge toasted caramel aroma. Loads of crackers and biscuits. Toasted barley. Oak and nuts. Rye bread. Huge complexity here. The flavor is loaded with toasted rye bread and crackers. Chocolate and caramel. Some hoppy notes. Oak. Boozy notes. Just brilliant.
Zwart bier zonder schuim. Vanille en cacao geur. Bitter-zoete lekkere chocolade smaak.

2012 vintage, bottle share at Earth Eagle. This is a thing of beauty. All of the strengths of an aged barleywine are here -- smoothness, sweetness, fantastic flavor -- and the barrel again counteracts any limpness or oxidization that you typically get by 3 years out. Strong flavor, rich and complex. Extremely highly recommended.

Tap at brewery. Pours black with tan head. Aroma is. Extremely dessert, caramel, molasses, brown sugar. Taste is full bodied, med carbonation, very rich, hot, bitter finish. Overall, goid but needs to age a bit.

2012 Bottle shared while at Brouwers in August 2015. Brown caramel color pour without any head on top. Aroma of bourbon and overly sweet malts. Flavor follows with some muddled sweet malts, a bit hot, a bit thin, and lots of oaky bourbon. Feel is on the thinner/harsh side overall, with little to no carbonation. I dont know if this was past its prime or what, but I was pretty disappointed. Not bad, but not up to expectations.

Bottle from somewhere in Portland. I was glad to find this one, and it seems to have aged nicely. Beautiful glowing brown pour. Boozy sweet nose, but not discomfiting. Relatively sweet but not too much so, hops present to bitter things out a bit but not all that prominent. Lots and lots of caramel, aged barleywine. Tasty stuff. Im a bit over barleywines, even BA barleywines, but this sure is a nice one.

2014 vintage. Thick viscous pour - dark golden brown. Looks dangerously good. Aroma is bourbon, vanilla, caramel, toffee. Taste is molasses, bitterness, syrupy, mild bourbon, booze, mild vanilla. Just a touch too much darker malt in my barleywine than I appreciate. Also alcohol is pretty prevalent. Great stuff, not the most complex one around but definitely super tasty.

At Richs Massive Cellar Emptying Tasting. Mother of all storms pelican 2010 13.5% 

Deep reddish brown with a malty rich stone fruit, maple syrup and some heat. Med-full bodied with a scratchy carbonation and big heat. The taste is malty sweet fruit, whiskey and heat. Its an alright big ass beer.
Rating from 2011 at Stockholm beer. This was wonderful, deep black colour, full aroma and great barrel aged taste.

2012 bottle, big thanks to hannont! Pours murky brown color with a wispy film that fades to a tiny collar. Aroma is awesome tootsie rolls mild bourbon chocolate toffee English malt. Taste is all of the above great tootsie rolls English malt chocolate toffee candied sugars soft bourbon, just fantastic! Palate is full stick with a nice dry finish. This stuff is so good!

2013 bottle at all killer no filler! Pours a burgundy brown with a minute frothy brown head. Aroma is caramel, toffee, vanilla and a touch of leather. Taste is caramel, vanilla, oak, leather and a moderate touch of bitterness with a minute sensation of cocoa.

Bottle to tulip
Caramel, port, vanilla, and bourbon. Dark brown with no head. Bourbon, caramel, wheat, and coffee.

650 ml bottle at Hasse, thanks! Amber brown with bright mocca head. Aroma sweet, malty, marmalade, alcohol, slight salt and some hops. Taste is salty, pretty sweet, toffee, sugar, alcohol, marmalade, mild hop notes, vinous dried fruits, plums, oh god this is great
Bottle @ ZEBF 2015. Aroma of raisin and vanilla. Taste has lots of malty raisin, sweet ripe red fruit, vanilla and mild bitters. Nice wedding of barley wine and port.
Not really a barley-wine lover, but this one I really enjoyed. Good sweet mixture with the malts, some booze. Liked it.
Sweet caramel and hazelnut aroma. Candy sugar, honey and sticky sugar finish. High liquor aftertaste.
Pours a dark amber brown. Aroma is caramel and molasses. Overall has a beautiful complexity and delicious sweet, malt flavor.

2013 vintage from a trade. Thanks ye nameless one!
Pours dark brown/red-brown with a small khaki coloured head.
Aroma is sweet, bready, caramel malty with bourbon and liquor-marzipan candy.
Taste is sweet, caramely with well balanced bourbon notes, some peppery/spicy notes, well balanced bitterness.
Full body, low carbonation, smooth and soft mouth feel.
Short warming after taste.
Wow! This BA Barley Wine has the usual elements that youd expect but everything is just that notch better than any other Ive had. Top notch beer!

Shared at a tasting hosted by Steebo on February 13. Im not sure on the vintage that was here. The pour is a nice black color with a khaki colored head that falls quickly. Looks like a strong porter or decent stout, rather than a barley wine. The aroma has lots of caramel and dark fruits. Heavy, heavy on the booze, but there is also a gorgeous vanilla and a decent wood presence. The flavor is damn. Lots of bourbon again. Dark fruits, caramel, vanilla, and a bourbon heat. The mouth feel is viscous and clingy, which is excellent. The carbonation is just such to help fizz up beautifully. The aftertaste is lingering dark fruits, a light roast, and some good bourbon heat. This is a pretty damn good beer, but Id pit it more of a porter/stout.

2014 vintage into a tulip. Pours a dark brown/black with some thin khaki edging. Nose is toffee, caramel, vanilla, and barrel. Loads of dark fruits and some residual char and booze that almost borders on savory. Taste is dark fruits and butterscotch into smooth oak and vanilla with some marshmallow and alcohol warmth. Lingering dates and bourbon with a touch of oxidation. Very well integrated. This is an excellent BA BW, and a long time want which I randomly found in a wine cooler in VT. Steep price tag but well worth it,

Cola colored... Aroma of caramel, vanilla, dark fruits, raisins, bourbon... Flavor is dark fruits, candi sugar, bourbon, vanilla, slight booze on finish... Some coca cola and raisiny notes... Solid

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Now were talking...
Looks as black as sin with rose highlights in the dimple of the glass. Virtually no head to speak of though. Aromas of molasses, carob (I hate carob) and beef consomme. It smells rich and mellow and a taste confirms as much. God, what a treat. Rich, oily body with traits of treacle and crude oil. Such a massive beer but still smooth enough to enjoy. A thick, viscous treasure with flavours of aged bourbon, mulberry, elderberry, toffee, coffee and lust. One of the greats.

Bottle: 2012 vintage, under a year old. Thanks, Ed. Deep, ruby-red & brown color, edging its way to darkness. Tan head grows to a quarter-inch before quickly receding to a small film. Dense aroma, heavy & robust as fuck. Sweet caramel, toasted brown sugar, molasses, heavy bourbon, woody oak, vanilla, candied & honey-drizzled dark fruits; prunes, figs, dates... This thing is a beast. The flavor is no different. The boozy warmth is amplified. Huge flavors of bourbon-soaked raisins, dates, plums, dipped in molasses & rolled in a charred brown sugar bath. Huge back-end flavors of wood, vanilla, faint char, & a little bit of cocoa dust. Malty sweet finish with lots of caramel & toffee, all whilst showing that big underbelly of bourbon. Syrupy, thick body. Great barleywine.
Bottle: 2013 vintage, relatively fresh. Delicious, tons of super sweet caramel, butter toffee, molasses, brown sugar, & dark fruit, cut perfectly with warm barrel tannins, oak, & soothing bourbon. Great beer as always, & lovely fresh. Maybe the best bottle Ive had.
Bottle: 2012 vintage, a little over two years old. Even with two years, the bourbon is a heavy hitter, full-force warmonger. Ive never had an issue with the booziness of MoAS, though, because it balances so well with the offsetting malty bomb sweetness. Honestly, aged isnt too much different from fresh. Delicious either way.
Bottle: 2010 vintage, about three years old or so. Thanks, Mike. Surprised that this one showed a minor bit of oxidation with a touch of papery staleness in the finish. Likely an issue with the bottle capping or the way it was stored. Carbonation a little lower than normal, also. Overall, still far from bad, but this one was an outlier.

2012 bomber pours a dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma of caramel and toffee malts, mild bourbon and oak, with dark dried fruits. Taste of sweet dark fruits, great caramel and toffee malt, with vanilla and oak, ending with a nice punch of bourbon. Very nice!

Many thanks to ron for the bottle. Enjoying the 10 vintage in 201502.

Pours a dark mohagony, ember red color, with a fizzy, small head, leaving back a thin alcohol legged lacing.

Complex aromas of toffeeish malts, syrup, molasses, getting wrapped up by wooden, slightly vanilla, hot Bourbon. Despite the barrel burn, the nose evokes a very sweet character, which gets topped by a sweet coca-cola like impression. Involves a note of slightly bitter coffee and bakers chocolate, inseparably blending into fudge and molasses. Although there is a prevailung sweetness, which I would usually pretty much diskike, the nose convinces by all its finely graduated nuances, and the very well developed, complex Bourbon barrel, easily balancing the toffee sweetness.

Tastes of bready, toffeeish, slightly creamy malts, with a very clean mouthfeel to it, until the Bourbon enters the scene, bringing a wooden, slightly dry alcohol bite with it, as well as a vanilla note, mingling with molasses, nougat and stale, oakie coffee. The boozy Bourbon bite is teeth numbing dominant, while getting toned down by glazed toffee and honey, building up a great balance between wooden booziness and caramelized sweetness. Due to the surprisingly convenient balance, there are many subtle flavors detectable, such as an acrid coffee tang, resulting from the rich Bourbon, paired against toasty, glazed vanilla, getting accompanied by hazelnuts. Has a hot dryness to it during the finish, enveloping the dried fruits, sweet malts, with molasses providing a long lasting aftertaste among the leathery, wooden Bourbon.

22 ounce bottle into snifter, bottled on 12/3/2013. Pours nearly opaque dark brown color with a 1 finger fairly dense tan head with poor retention, that reduces to a thin ring pretty quickly. Some minimal spotty lacing on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of raisin, prune, fig, date, caramel, molasses, toffee, toast, brown bread, bourbon, oak, light vanilla, light tobacco, and oak/toasted earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of dark/bready malt, fruity yeast, and oak barrel notes; with good strength. Taste of big caramel, molasses, toffee, toast, brown bread, raisin, prune, fig, date, bourbon, oak, leather, tobacco, light vanilla, light chocolate, and oak/toasted earthiness. Slight oaky bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of caramel, toffee, toast, molasses, brown bread, raisin, prune, fig, date, bourbon, oak, leather, tobacco, and oak/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Outstanding complexity and balance of dark/bready malt, fruity yeast, and oak barrel flavors; with zero cloying sweetness present after the finish. Light carbonation and full bodied; with a very creamy, fairly slick, and lightly syrupy mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is well hidden with a small-moderate warming present after the finish. Overall this is an awesome barrel aged English barelywine style. All around great complexity and balance of dark/bready malt, fruity yeast, and oak barrel flavors; and fairly smooth to sip on for the huge ABV. A highly enjoyable offering, but I feel that the base beer is more impressive than this one.

650ml bottle shared at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki, courtesy of AntonFred. Dark brown color with small beige head which quickly disappears. Malty aroma, caramel, bourbon - alcohol, chocolate, fruity. Sweet and bitter taste, wood, alcohol, fruits, chocolate. Medium oily body with flat carbonation.
Good beer, but certainly not worth the cost...bought it at Bi-Mart for $20. I still like my favorite...Full Sail Bourbon Barrel Aged Imperial Stout..

Dark drown color with a thin beige head. Aromas of bourbon caramel and vanilla. Taste is really sweet with vanilla, bourbon and caramel at first, followed by hints of chocolate, dark fruits. Full body with low carbonation.

Bottle. Pours a very dark reddish brown color with a moderate off white head on there. Nose has a lot of roasting to it with some caramel and just a hint of bourbon. The taste is dark and roasty, with a smoothness of a velvety beer and with a little bourbon to it. Like a very stouty barleywine.

Mac slänger upp en flarra efter middag hemma hos sig. Min första reaktion är att det måste vara chili i den här. Blir snabbt nedröstad och utbuad. Hettan kan omöjligt komma från alkoholen och det bara måste finnas något annat starkt i den här. Väldigt trevlig och trots att den är ung (2013) har den anmärkningsvärt mycket härliga lagrade toner i engelsk barleywine-stil. Russin, nötter, fudgekola, dadlar osv. Härligt.

Bottle at a tasting at Butler's place. Pours a ruby brown. Aroma is malty with dark fruits. Lots of chocolate. Flavor follows and is huge. Lots and lots of chocolate. Super yummy. Full bodied. Thanks Troy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2016 Im not normally a fan of the style (too high in the intoxication stakes) - but this brew has me thinking I could (and should) be!  Subtly complex in a way that totally hides its strength makes this dangerously delicious. Yikes.

2012 bottle in a tulip, on a Tuesday, got your girl in the cut and she choosy. Pours deep brown with a tan head. Aroma strong of bourbon, caramel and toffee and light nuttiness, hints of vanilla and oak, very light alcohol notes, and some bitterness from the hops. Flavor the same with a great blend. Smooth texture. A really good beer.

Poured 2014 from tap to glass. Dark hue with creamy tan head that dissipated to a ring. Aroma is toffee, plum, caramel, raisins, vanilla, wood. Mouthfeel is great with a full body and soft carbonation. Taste is sweet with a balanced bitterness following and warming ethanol finish. Overall this is a fantastic brew.

11 bottle from westmeister enjoyed Christmas 14. Long time want here-thanks, West! Deep caramel brown color. Nose of rich bourbon, barrel, and light oxidation. Slightly burnt caramel, toffee, tobacco, dark wildflower honey, some oxidation, sweet barrel elements. Great, edges out Blighs for me mainly on the palate and mouthfeel.

22 ounce bottle shared by Timfoolery, lots of barrel, sweet, golden brown. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
2011 vintage, pours a murky brown with almost no head. Aroma is rich sweet malt and oak and bourbon. taste is big bourbon barrel presence with tons of toasted malts, really big beer, tons of booze
Bottle (22oz $22). 2014 vintage. Dark ruby brown. One finger tan head which quickly disappears. Taste is quite sweet with bourbon. Too sweet for my liking.

Poured from a 2012 vintage 22 oz bottle. 
Aroma had a medium light bourbon character. Moderate raisin and dark fruit notes with lighter toffee and caramel notes. Light toast character with hints of smoke. Light alcohol spice and light cardboard oxidation. Hints of soy sauce. 
Pours a dark, murky, brown with some amber hues and a moderately sized, somewhat thin, mocha head with average retention that lingers on the edges. Light lacing and moderate legs. 
Flavor has a light sweetness with moderate toffee and caramel notes. Lighter roast and faint smoke with light chocolate. Moderate to moderately strong raisin, prune and dark fruit. Light bourbon and alcohol spice. Medium cardboard oxidation with light soy sauce. 
Mouthfeel is medium full bodied with medium low carbonation. Low astringency and medium low also warmth. 
Overall, this beer has not aged well. The dark fruit and oxidation are showing through and not helping this beer at all. Nice dark fruit and bourbon notes though.

Draft at Big Wood 2014 at Brouwers. Jet black, small gorgeous white ring. soft oaky chocolate, subdued hops. Rich deep chocolate, some espresso. Crisp and clean, all told. Toasty grain, oatmeal. Really tasty, Id love to try this again soon.

2012 vintage bottle shared at RichTheVillans, 27/11/13. Clear ruby amber brown, cream to tan head that dies. Massive toffee caramel bourbon nose, loads of figs and dates, plus some hot booze. Starts hugely sweet, layers of caramel and toffee and more rich fruit, then dries out a bit with oak, tobacco, spice, and some hop bitterness. Sticky and thick, soft carb. Very nice, though I think another year or 2 to dry it out and it wouldve been better.

2013 bottle, cellared for a year at ambient basement temps. Served chilled in a Spiegelau snifter. Dark reddish, nearly brown with a one fingered head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is dark caramel, toffee and booze. Taste is caramelized turbinado sugar, non-distinct booze, subtle prunes, maybe a touch of oak. There doesnt seem to be an excess of bourbon notes, but a general booziness that could detract from the other flavors. A bit too sweet. Quite honestly, I could see this being a much more interesting beer after 5 years, the oxidation will hopefully add some depth to the flavor, tame the booziness (which is not over the top by any means) and unaccentuate the sweetness. Right now it is just not that interesting. I would like to try the un-BA version, Stormwatchers Winterfest.

2012 bottle purchased from Lets Pour.
Dark brown body with almost a head, but not quite.
Rich, complex aroma. Alcohol, cognac, maple sugar, raisins.
Very sweet and syrupy. Flavor otherwise matches the aroma. Gotta sip this one slow like an Avery.

Dark ruby color when looking into the light. Very nice aroma: toffee, caramel, dark malts, bourbon. Taste starts sweet with dark sugar and molasses and finishes more balanced with caramel and toffee. Mouthfeel is syrupy with just a bit of carbonation to make it easily drinkable. One of the best English style barleywines I had.
Bottle. Surly Darkness Eve 2014. Perfect balance of sweet and tart and booze and malt. So good!

Bottle from Darrel in a trade. Thanks!! Shared with Peter and Gail. Snifter pour was deep dark cherry wood with a small mocha head. No real lacing. The aroma was divine with toffee, caramel, vanilla, oak barrel, bourbon, booze, and a hint of tobacco. The taste was just as pleasant with the caramel and toffee malts hitting first and then the barrel aged oak and bourbon at the end. Also it almost had a brandy flavor. Serious smoothness and delicate on the palate. Full body, full flavors. Damn fine beer.

2009 bottle opened in 2014. Smells like the barrel it was housed in - smoky, woody, dark fruits. Taste is the same. Creamy and thick with a distinct alcohol "burn" and some good toffee notes. Strong and a real kick in the teeth. I think oxidation played more of a role here than I would have liked. Still decent.

"2011. Sweet fig and caramel beer, and a large dose of bourbony vanilla. The body is thinner than expected for such a strong beer, but its pretty smooth. A little alcohol showing, more so in the aroma, but thats expected at 13%. Pretty nice."

2011 bottle. Beautiful aroma of decadent toffee, caramel, a touch of old cardboard, a hint of smoky oak and mild yet delightful bourbon. Pours murky dark mahogany with a tan head and crystal-like lacing. Nice, smooth taste of medium chocolate, almond butter, caramel fudge with very mild bourbon  theres barely any hot booze  with notes of vanilla and subtle oak popping up late. Incredibly smooth texture with a medium body and light carbonation. A delicious beer, but I may have aged it a smidge too long, for it tasted better to me a few years back (except for the velvet palate).

Shared vintage 2010 bottle with a friend. Poured a dark ruby colour with no head. What an awesome smell of Bourbon notes! Oak, malts, lot of vanilla, toffee, caramel, leather, marshmallows, Bourbon soaked raisins, Bourbon. Real smooth and full bodied mouthfeel. Boy this is tasty stuff! One hell of a barley wine!

2011 version, sampled at Brau Beviale 2012. 
Big molassis, cognac, kahlua. 
Chestnut, golden layer.
Honeyish, caramel roast, molassis, vineous notes. 
Thick mouthfeel, chewy.
Good stuff
Pours a very dark brown color with tan head. Caramel malt, toffee, vanilla, bourbon, and oak on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with a sweet note.

660 ml bottle at home - 2010 vintage. Pours deep red amberwith a quickly dissapearing yellow eggshell head. Deep resinous and wine-alike nose, plums, raisins, figs and a load of alcohol, a bit of vanilla. Medium body with an imminent alcohol burn, slightly countered by some candi Sugar sweetness. Taste is madeira notes of dates and nuts. Not a bad barley wine, but there are way more subtle ones out there.

22 oz. bottle, 2012 vintage, shared by phatdog1. Deep mahogany color with a wisp of a reddish brown head, which disappears immediately. Lots of different scents here. Dark fruit, caramel malt, vanilla, bourbon, oak tannins and red wine. Port and red wine flavor. More alcohol than in the aroma. Notes of bourbon barrel and dark fruit. Not overly sweet. Full bodied and rich. Really begin to notice the alcohol towards the end.

22 oz. bottle 2012 vintage shared by Phatdog1. Dark mahogany color with no head. Aroma is damn nice with the flavor to match. Nose of toasted caramel, burnt molasses, vanilla oak, and dried dark fruits. The bourbon is barely noticeable but still there. 
Flavor is rich and has a layered complexity. Toffee, figs and thick molasses upfront. Mild oak vanilla and raisin through the center leading to a subtle, gentle bourbon in the finish. The bourbon is a nice accent to all the deep layers of malts. A nice warming sensation after the sip. Thick nearly sticky texture. Overall this is a killer barely wine, delicious!

From the 2012 batch bottled on 11/15/12. Thanks phatdog1! The pour is brown with red hues. Great toasted barley malty notes with almost a chocolate nip. Medium to full body. Great barleymalt sweetness without the alcohol bite. It has mellowed nicely in 2 years.

At Zeebra II. Very good looking beer, ruby red with a small head on top, average retention.
Aroma of malts, dark fruits, a bit of caramel and toffee.
Taste of prunes, quite some alcohol. Raisins, malts, toffee, burnt caramel.
Medium thick body, good carbonation, nicely dry on the palate.
Great beer.

At Zeebra Beer Festival, THX to everybody sharing todays beers.
APPEARANCE: clear dark brown beer, small unstable beige head.
NOSE: coffee, caramel, sweet.
TASTE: caramel, very sweet, alcohol.
Sampled @ Zeebra 2014. Good Barely Wine. Bourbon smell. Very sweet. Good beer, okay. Prefer imperial stouts, though.

Have had every vintage of this since 2008. This is one of those big bad boys you know youre going to love just from the aroma wafting off the brim of the glass. Bourbony, boozey, biting your palate a bit at a time. Damn good brew, but has gotten a bit over priced the past few years.

22 oz bottle shared with the group in 2012 (from notes) and a few times since. Pours an amber brown color with a small beige head. The aroma and flavor have big sweet caramel and buttery toffee, bourbon, vanilla, dark ripe fruits, raisin and oak with just a hint of char. Early it was a bit boozy, but that calmed down with warming. Assertive and on the sweet side, but this is a solid beer.

2012 bottle shared by Tommy. Ive had this before but do not remember it being so damned sweet. Holy shit, I could hardly drink a sip of this. Super cloying, syrupy and sugary sweet. Some light oak, big sweet bourbon, vanilla, and caramel. Woo boy. Too much for me.

A- Pours a very dark, reddish brown with a small brown head that fades quickly.

S- Very oaky, deep bourbon notes, brown sugar, caramel, hints of toffee.

T- Dark fruits up front, fig and plum followed by a wave of bourbon, brown sugar and faint piney hops.

M- Thick with medium carbonation.

D- Extremely drinkable for a beer this big. So well rounded. The strong and complex malt presence complemented perfectly by an equal wave of bourbon on the back end.
Bottle at the Triad bottle share at Foothills organized by Mike. Luscious profile of dark fruits, chocolate, coconut, and toffee. Almost stout like in its darkness. Velvety and damn good.
Had this at recent tasting. This is by far the best barleywine Ive had. Excellent stuff. (2011)
amazing what a couple of years can do to a barley wine. along with FW Subaca, this is the best one ive ever had. (2011).

Sample from bottle at Nieuwjaarsborrel 2014, 2011 vintage, thanks for sharing Kermis! Pours almost dark brown with a reddish glow and a small off-white head. Aroma is boozy, dark fruits, wood, caramel and boubon. Taste has caramel, dark fruits, some chocolate, quite sweet and some alcohol. Over medium body and medium carbo.

Bottle at Mr Hangovers 2014 Nieuwjaarsborrel, Den Haag and courtesy of Kermis. Poured a clear dark brown with a bubbly tan round head. The aroma is pure malt ovaltine maltesers caramel. The flavour is medium to strong bitter medium sweet with a rich malty boozy alcoholic liqourice chocolate palate. Full bodied with flat carbonation. An oily mouthfeel with a long smooth bitter finish. A superb beer. Well deserving of the rating. Might get a little sickly after the second pint though :-)

Bottle shared at Nieuwjaarsborrel thanks to trade with Troganmi. Pours brown with a tiny ring beige head. Aroma has massive, wood, malt, light vanilla, cookies, light overripe dark fruits. Flavor is heavy sweet. Its like drinking boozy maltesers with molasses. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle at Nieuwjaarsborrel. Pours cloudy brown with no head. Huge aroma of wood, caramel, raisin, ripe fruits, banana, bourbon and booze. Taste is very sweet and moderate bitter. Full bodied and quite sticky. Long fruity finish. Amazing beer. Very complex and yet very smooth. Incredible.

Bottle @ Nieuwjaarsborrel 2014, courtesy of kermis. Pours a clear reddish beer with a small off white head on top. Aroma is caramel, booze and bourbon. Big barrel characteristics going on in the aroma. Flavor is very sweet, alcoholic, malty and has big caramel touches. Sweeet, cloying aftertaste. This is amazing, full bodied beer with loads of things going on. Its slightly overwhelmed by the bourbon characters, but still very very good.

Bottle @ nieuwjaarsborrel. Aroma is big caramel, bread, sugar, toffee, some liquorice, malt etc etc. Flavour is caramel, chocolate, liquorice, alcohol, toffee, malteser, malt etc etc. Great but very sweet and caramelly.

Bottle @ Nieuwjaarsborrel 2014, hosted by MrHangover. Hazy brown pour. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, roasted malts, licorice, bourbon, vanilla, leather and quite boozy. Flavor is quite sweet, boozy and harsh, but very full bodied. Lovely brew.

Sample @nieuwjaarsborrel
No head. Clear deep burgundy pour. Clear alcohol. A very good barley wine.

Poured a dark amber color with aromas of bourbon, toffee, caramel, vanilla, oak, and light licorice. Flavors are the same a smooth blend of caramel, toffee and bourbon. Drinkable and smooth, dangerous.

Glass, 4 ounces, draught, on the premise during a trip to Portland (Oregon), savoured on January 17 2014; eye: dark brown, clear, no effervescence, no head, no lacing; nose: malt, alcohol, woody, bourbon, oxidation, molasses, alcohol; mouth: malt, alcohol, woody, bourbon, oxidation, molasses, alcohol, alcohol warmth, finale in malt with presence of alcohol, full body, below-average carbonation, mildly sweet, lightly sticky texture; overall: quite fine

FRANÇAIS

Verre, 4 onces, en fût, sur place lors dun voyage à Portland (Orégon), savourée le 17 janvier 2014; il : brun foncé, limpide, pas deffervescence, pas de mousse, pas de dentelle; nez : malt, alcool, boisé, bourbon, oxydation, mélasse, alcool; bouche : malt, alcool, boisé, bourbon, oxydation, mélasse, alcool, chaleur dalcool, finale en malt avec présence dalcool, corsée, carbonatation sous la moyenne, moyennement sucrée, texture légèrement collante; en résumé : bien bon

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2014 Draft - Vintage 2013 - Licorice, prune, dark malts and bourbon. Dark mahogany with a thin brown head. Molasses, dark fruit, bourbon and vanilla, but roasty as well. This has the color and dark malt profile of something other than a barleywine. I would have never guessed if given blind.  Vintage 2009 - Rich chocolate and light bourbon notes.  Dark chocolaty amber with almost no head.  Roasty, booze and dark fruit.  Again very dark and rich, unlike normal barley wines.
sample of 2012 & 2011. deep caramel color. Full bodied. aromas & flavors of deep rich caramel & toffee males, bourbon, oak, vanilla. Awesome

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2014 2012 bottle poured into a tulip. Got this from Brent or Aaron awhile back. Cant remember who. Pours dark ruby brown with very little head. Im greeted by a blast of toasty malt, oak, pancake syrup, and bourbon. The taste is toasted oak, caramel, leather, tobacco, and maple syrup which meld together throughout the syrupy mouthfeel. Pretty boozy. A powerhouse.
22oz bottle. Mohagany pour, ring of tan head. Nose of dark fruit, bourbon, vanilla, brown sugar. Flavors of oak, vanilla, slight sweetness, wood.

On draught at Pelican Brewing Company, vertical flight of 2011 to 2013. Deep chocolate brown color, darker as they age. Aroma is bourbon, raisin, oak, vanilla; more boozy in 2013, more molasses in 2011. Taste is candi sugar, bourbon, vanilla, molasses, caramel. Sweetest in 2012, more viscous molasses in 2011. All very boozy, with most dark syrup in 2011.

2011 on draught at pelican. Pours dark amber with medium thick tan head. Nose of molasses, booze, and caramel. Taste is of dark molasses, malt, syrup, and an overall warming boozy finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle share thanks to Homer321. Big grainy, oaty, chocolate, light roast aroma. Big malty flavor, dark fruits, plum, some light grainy character to balance. Overall just delicious.

Draft at Bigwood, from notes. dark pour, no head, opaque. Aroma: dark fruit - plum, steeping grains, toffee, chocolate. Very nice. Vanilla and all. Taste: damn. Sweet, rich, plum goodness. Nice! Rich thick sexy dark fruits; anise/licorice/red vines. Minor bitterness. Palate: full body, slick texture, really nice long aftertaste. Overall: this is legit. Damned good.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2014 vintage 2013
Cola brown with a rim caramel of foam.  Otherwise theres a cool central circle that then dissipates into four circles, giving it a major freeway intersection look.  Smells like bubble gum up front, some vanilla, oak, bourbon. Nice nose, a little on the artificial side.  Flavor is malts, alcohol, sweet candi sugar, some cherry.  Medium bodied with low carb and a dry finish.  This is a good beer, but not worth over $1/oz. 


10/3/9/4/19 - 4.5
Vintage 2011 - Thanks Jamie!
Pours a cherry leather with a rim of dark tan foam. Smells nougat, bourbon, raisins, chocolate and chewy caramel. Aromas of cake and sugar - a sincerely exquisite nose. Mmmm, cherry, tawny, sweet vanilla cake, rich mousse and caramels. Goddam, this is a good beer. Full bodied for the style with just a hare more carb than I prefer with a good, sticky and chewy finish. This is a truly excellent beer. I think I prefer this to KH, which is a great beer.

Serving type: bottle

04-24-2012

2012 bottle. Dark brown/ruby shade with ring of tan foam. Aroma is heavy on dark, sticky fruits, adding wisps of chocolate, smoke and a lighter-than-expected bourbon presence. Taste is brimming with sticky toffee and barrel influence. Hint of anise spiciness in the finish. Thick mouthfeel with no real trace of heat. I think Ive had more complex barleywines, but few as delicious and easy to drink. A superb example.

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2014 On tap at Brouwer?s Big Wood 2013. Honestly? This smells like a fruit roll-up. Artificial cherry, and it tastes like a sweet, young barley wine. Not bad, but this was definitely not my favorite.
RE-RATE 12-4-2014: A year later, this is a *lot* better. Super-smooth, more chocolate than fruit. Much better!
Bottle from International Trade; deep ruby red pour with bubbly tan head, bourbon aroma, big bourbon taste, very sweet, a hint of hop bitterness, some caramel, big ABV present.

Bomber of 2012 Vintage, shared. Pours reddish brown with beige head. Nose is bourbon, molasses, vanilla. Flavor is dark fruit, caramel, bourbon, raisin, brown sugar, peet. Syrupy mouthfeel. Very rich, reminded me some of Backwoods Bastard.

Pours black, finger tan head. 

Smell huge bourbon whisky, oak and vanilla.

Taste smooth coco, huge oak, strong boozy aftertaste.

Mid to full body.

Solid
#3000. 2012 bottle. Deep dark brown with a tan top. Scent is caramel, wood and booze. Taste is caramel, vanilla, toast and sweet chocolate. Sticky. Good stuff!

Something isnt right here... 2012 vintage. Pours a copper color with a finger of eggshell foam. Rich burnt toffee, caramel and a touch of boozy fig notes. The palate was all wrong... weird, thin, slightly fishy with traces of black tea and burnt marshmallow. Not sure whats going on here but it was poured into the campfire at the end of the night. Hmmm ?

2012 bottle. Pours with a light brown with garnet highlights. minimal head that dissipates quickly nose full of vanilla and malt sweetness/sugar, some dried cherries. Taste is similar with a thick, viscous mouthfeel. some warming on the back end, slightly hot/fusely. Besides, the noticeable alcohol, a great beer. I dont remember it being this "hot" in years past.

Bottle 2/6/11.
Clear deep amber body with a thin light brown head
Sweet caramel vanilla oak and fruit aroma
Sweet vanilla oak caramel fruit and mild malt flavor
Medium full body mod low carb very smooth

Bomber 2012. Ruby brown with a beige head. Sweet, barley, pear liquor, initial vegetably, some vanilla and oak. Quite sweet, moderate+ body, low carbonation long boozy finish. Think I might want to wait a little longer to try this again but interesting for sure.

Red brown colour, beige head. Aroma of red fruits, malts, alcohol, whisky and bourbon. Sweet flavour, molases, vanilla, Bourbon, peach and maple. Finish raisins, Bourbon, vanilla, wood and alcohol. Very nice! Full and complex. Quite honestly I wouldnt want to drink the whole bottle, but its brilliant for sipping, like a nice Sauternes or the like.
(From 75cL bottle @ RBBSG II, Gent 2013. Thanks for sharing, ThirstyBird!!)
Dark red, brownish pour but still transparent. Very sweet, very smooth, not very heavy on the bourbon.

10/VIII/13 - 1Pt. 6Fl. Oz. bottle @ RBBSG II, my place - BB: n/a (2013-743) Thanks to ThirstyBird for sharing the bottle!
Clear red to red brown beer, no noticeable head. Aroma: lots of caramel, mocha, sugary, dried fruits, alcohol, honey, maple syrup. MF: ok carbon, full body. Taste: lots and lots of chocolate, vanilla, caramel, sugary, sweet mocha. Aftertaste: sweet caramel, bit sugary, vanilla, mocha, alcohol, pretty sweet finish. Very complex and mighty beer, love it!

2012 bottle shared. Pours cloudy brown with minimal head. Aroma is sweet boozy malts with some creamy bourbon. I will say at room temp this beer was significantly better than cold. The flavors developed nicely with sweet caramel malts, vanillay bourbon, sweet molasses. Quite nice,but not quite up to the 4 range for me. I have another 2011 sitting down in the cellar and wondering if it is on the way down....

2012 Vintage courtesy of MeadMe, thanks for the opportunity!
Pours a solid dark brown with the faintest of ruby highlights when held to light and a smallish off white head that dissipates quickly to a ring on top. Huge brown sugary caramel malty aroma with lots of deep dark fruits and bits of vanilla. coconut and wood. Sweet sugary malt flavor with a solid hit of alcohol. Dark fruits caramel prunes wood and vanilla are all there in the flavor. Hints of bourbon oak and oak tannin round out the flavor. Medium to thick body with a light level of carbonation and a sweet almost syrupy mouthfeel. Ive had this before and remember enjoying it a bit more. Its a nice barleywine, but I feel the alcohol is a bit too present and may need a bit of time to mellow out.

2010 vintage. Deep amber brown, almost opaque, thin beige lacing. Raisins, caramel, toffee apple, figs, bourbon, and damp wood. Sticky, sweet, and boozy with a light bitterness in the finish. Lively carbonation, full-bodied, and still retains a very strong bourbon barrel character.

Bomber: I've been holding onto this gem for 6 months. Fantastic aroma. Pitch black with skiff of fine bubbles lining the perimeter. Rich aroma like raisin rum cake. Sweet forward with hints of plum, molasses & toffee. Lovely, luxurious desert!. ~m

--RaucusBacchus
Best beer I have had yet. Was given to me and shared as a birthday gift for my 36th birthday.

Courtesy of ThirstyBird. Thx! 65 cl. bottle sampled @ RBBSG II. 2010 Vintage. Pours bright raspberry red amber with no head ~ very interesting colour. Sweet bourbon caramel nose, very sweet, pure caramel, brown sugar, molasses goo with wood vanilla and sticky maple syrup. Taste is sweet bourbon, molasses, maple, very sweet brown sugar, bourbon vanilla wood goo, light booze, sticky, slight bitter herbs in the back. Very caramelized. Light dark fruits syrup. Sticky molasses body, not a lot of carbonation. Very nice & very satisfactory.

Sampled from bottle @ RBBSG II. Clear dark red color like a barleywine should be, small beige head. Smell malts, bourbon. Taste malts, bourbon, strong alcohol, slightly vanilla. Incredibly nice. Superb beer, heavy but good. Damn.

This is my kind of barley wine right here. The pour was a deep reddish-brown with an off-white frothy lil fuggin head. Aromas were full of toffee, cherries, bourbon and wet oak - and the taste followed as well. Undertones of caramelized raisins, berries and subtle oak really come together nicely. Thanks for the share, OmegaX.

Ive wanted to try this for a while. 2011 bottle. Nose is thick, strong malts, caramel, light bourbon, resinous and citrusy hops, red fruits. Nice stuff. Flavor is a nice balance of barrel notes, citrusy hops and fruity/malty notes. It reminded me of a better version of arrogant bastard. Very smooth palate.
UPDATED: AUG 3, 2013 Bottle share. 2012. Clear ruby. Earthy, spice, vanilla, chocolate, raisin, molasses, more vanilla. Nice, dry finish. Great mask of abv.

Ruby brown with virtually no head. Aroma is chocolate, raisins, dates, malt. Slightly slick mouthfeel, sweet on the palate, slightly boozy finish. Taste is chocolate, prunes, dates, cocoa powder. Nice.

Bomber at a bottle sharing. Pours dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma of caramel, bourbon, fruit, and brown sugar. Taste is caramel, bourbon, dark fruit, brown sugar, wood, and a touch of hops. Very nice sipper.

2011 bomber.  Pretty vigorous pour yielded a bit of head that vanished quickly.  Nose of sweet caramel, toffee, booze and marshmallow.  Tastes follows the nose with some produced heat still present.  Yet another very good English BW

22oz 2010 bomber via trade. Poured a rather ugly mud bank dark brown with a smaller giant bubbly dark beige head. Aroma is great, sweet overall but natural and not over the top, notes of vanilla, sweet bourbon alcohol, syrupy, wood, maple. Body is on the full syrupy side with soft carbonation and medium heat. Overall perfect for this beer but the carbonation is nice for an aged barreled beer. Flavor is the best part of this beer. Notes of caramel, vanilla, wood,bourbon, touch of chocolate, torched marshmallow, alcohol, some raisin and fig, dough. Great beer.
Bottle. Clear brown beer with almost no head. Malty, chocolate and bourbon aroma. Malty, dark fruits, chocolate and vanilla flavour. Lovely beer :-)

Bomber thanks to peteinSD - 2012 - thick dark ruby pour - minimal lace, but still a surprising amount of carbonation for the abv - the tannins, vanilla, and coconut character of the barrel is evident first in the nose, followed by some toffee, treacle, brown sugar, date, mild to moderate diacetyl (causing me to knock the nose score down one number) - slick mouthfeel, low carbonation -very sweet up front - fig paste, fruitcake, sponge pudding, toffee - some damp, bitter oakiness and spicy, peppery alcohol arrive late to cut the sweetness just a bit, but still cloying throughout - warming but not boozy whiskey finish, with lingering treacle sweetness, mild oxidation - obviously well-crafted, just soooo sweet - I consider finishing this bomber a testament to my manliness - but I am going to regret this in the morning.

bottle share at BW - pre-hill farmstead 3rd anniversary. pours very dark brown with a beige head atop, some retention. loads of bourbon vanilla and coconut, cloying molasses, raisins, burnt caramel, earthy, licorice. soft carbonation, full body - sticky and sweet. not my type of BW.

2011 bottle thanks to Endo, split on train 500 between Portland and Seattle, 10.30 am BW breakfast - oh yeah ! 27/05/13.
Dark mahogony brown with a thin tan head that clears to the edge and lingers.
Nose is Christmas cake, dark toffee, brown sugars, dates, chocolate, woody notes, brown bread dough.
Taste comprises Xmas pudding, woody notes, toffee fudge, dates, prunes, sultanas, sticky toffee pudding with caramel sauce, demerara sugars, all things sweet and good.
Full bodied, smooth on the palate, sweet finish but not overly so for a 13% monster, booze evident but as with the sweetness, this is well tempered.
This is a top draw barley wine!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared at Richards Graduation Party (Western Springs, IL). Thanks, guys! Pours a rich deepish copper pour, good haze. Glowing copper edges with frothy tannish head. Aromas are toasty, bisccuity, a touch sweet. Some cocoa, vanilla, gentle oak. Some caramel, toast, and toffee. Some cocoa, gentle tannic feel, a bit more dry. Initial is medium bodied, a bit thicker, cocoa and roast, tannic a bit with good barrel. Thicker toffee, toast and carmelization as we enter the middle. Very well put together. Some toffee, backend is a bit tannic, some heat, and sweetness. Very nice.
Pours blackish amber with light head. Notes of super rich bourbon, plums, english malt, oak, banana bread, dark fruit and luxurious boozey richness throughout. Medium to full body. Light carb. Great!

Shared bottle with Timfoolery. This bottle was full of sweet malty goodness aka SMG. If youre a fan of sweet full flavored beer then this ones for you. Hits the palate with Carmel and molasses just like a barley wine should. WOW!!

Bottle from some trade. Aroma and flavor of SMG..."sweet malty goodness."  (Thanks for the drop DTM.) Really malty caramel and sweet flavor makes this taste like a caramel turtle fudge brownie...literally. I know most don't dig a sweet beer, but "I'm your huckleberry." Loved this beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber of 2012 Vintage. Dark reddish brown in appearance with a thin layer of beige head. The aroma is heavy on the bourbon and molasses in addition to some vanilla and dark fruits. The taste blends caramel, bourbon and black cherry upfront followed by notes of raisin, date and burnt sugar. Also a noticeable oaked alcohol characteristic present throughout each sip. Mouthfeel is sticky and syrupy with low carbonation and a final onslaught of bourbon and caramelized sugars in the finish. Rich and potent as you would expect with plenty of complex flavors to savor.
Holy caramel Batman! Dark brown clear pour. Tan head. Awesome mouthfeel - tons of caramel. Very nice. Did I mention the caramel?

Bottle, from trade with MtGoat. Pours a deep red-hued brown body with a small, light beige head. Aroma is deep mellow velvety bourbon notes with deep malty caramel tones, hints of nuts, biscuits and toffee; all integrated smoothly in the back. Taste is smooth deep malty tones with well-balanced bourbon tones, soy, coconut and hints of toffee. Full, elegantely textured body with a well-fitting medium carbonation level. Absolutely lovely beverage.

Bottle - WALEZ tasting. Pours beautiful clear deep ruby with a small beige head that leaves decent lacing. Aroma is caramel, brown sugar, dried fruit, a touch of bourbon. Flavor is the same, medium sweet, light bitter, bit of wood and its associated astringence. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, warming finish. Good beer; probably should not have had it AFTER the King Henry tho :)
Bottle.Pours a deep black with a nose of winey roasted nuts and chocolate fudge.   Taste is similar.  Nice beer.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text:
Bomber thanks to Mark.
Appearance : Deep clear brown with small head.

Aroma : Rich raisins and brown sugar. Light licorice, delightful rich sugars. Lightly smoked caramel with great herbal hops.

Taste : Rich raisins with light vanilla. Pumpernikel bread with herbal hops. Bitter hops on the finish. Light oxidation.

Palate : Nice soft carbonation. Nice palate overall.

Overall : Very nice and rich. Well balanced. Nice complex malty flavors. nice hop profile too. Exactly the kind of barley wine that I enjoy. Really well made. Nice light oxidation.

Bottle @ home ... vintage 2012... It pours clear dark brown with a small light brown head....The aroma is bourbon, raisins, dark fruit and caramel....The flavor is very nice dark fruit, bourbon, sweet dark fruits, brown sugar and oak...

Location: 22 oz bottle shared by NickD717, 3/2/13


Aroma: The nose is fairly heavy malty, with caramel, wood, vanilla, some fruit, and quite a bit of booze

Appearance: This one pours a dark reddish color with a smallish beige head and some average lace

Flavor: The flavor is pretty big with some heavy malts, lots of booze, and some hop bitterness too

Palate: This ber is full bodied with a thick feel and, of course, a big boozy punch from the ABV

Overall Impression: 
Thanks Nick!  This one is certainly a sipper.  Theres really no argument that this is some very good stuff, but I still would have preferred just a bit less heat.

2011 bottle thanks to dreadnaught33. Deep black cherry pour. Nose and flavor hold big booze, vanilla, marzipan and almond, plum, and caramel. Good depth of flavor, but thinnish on the palate. Still tasty.

Bottle: Poured a lightly cloudy dark brown color ale with a medium size head with good retention and some light lacing. Aroma of light whisky notes with some brown sugar, toffee and some pretty robust caramelized malt notes. Taste is a great mix between some toffee notes with some brown sugar and caramelized malt with some whisky notes which kinds of round off the rough edge. Body is quite full with good carbonation and no real apparent alcohol. Very well done but I would have like the residual sugar to be more subtle which would have provide more space for the malt backbone to shine.

Bottle at home. 2011 Vintage. Pour is deep brown with small cream head that quickly dissipated. Big coconut, bourbon, vanilla, candi sugar, caramel, light roast, toffee, and booze in the aroma; really starts to open up as you let it warm. Taste is caramel, raisins, figs, woody, big bourbon, vanilla, coconut, brown sugar, somewhat toasty, and grassy with a light alcoholic bite on the finish. Creamy mouthfeel with soft carbonation. An excellent English-style barley wine, but a bit too sweet and boozy for me.

Pours unclear dark coffee amber with an off white head. The aroma brings delicious sweet and boozy barrel and malty flavors combined well. The flavor is so smooth bringing sweet and hoppy malts with a perfectly carbonated body. The bourbon barrel brings the sweet boozy notes, but smooth with no bite, so enjoyed on the palate.

Bottle from newcigarz, on the night that NOTB should have been.  Dark reddish brown with a small brown head.  Aroma is bourbon, caramel, vanilla, molasses, dark fruits.  Taste is very sweet, dominated by bourbon but in a good way.  Almost no alcohol.  Finish is oak, some roastiness. Very full bodied, syrupy, smooth.  Great stuff.

This beer has a wonderful chocolate smell with a wonderful finish. Love it!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2012 version served from a bottle at Baileys Taproom.

Aroma: caramel, chocolate, roasty. Id be ok with just holding this beer and breathing in the delicous aromas.

Appearance: black, thick with a minimal head

Taste: Medium sweetness with tastes of caramel, chocolate, molasses with some roastiness and of course bourbon.

Overall: Delicious! This is the second time Ive had this beer and each time the bottle has cost me $25 which I dont mind since I tend to share it with people at the bar.

Brassin 2011. Bouteille de 22 oz partagée lors dune dégustation Ratebeer Montréal. Arôme: Légère odeur de caramel et de petits fruits. Apparence: La couleur est ambrée foncée. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Gout sucré avec une pointe de caramel et de raisins secs. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement vineuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de raisins secs en arrière goût. (Rating #4582)

Bottle '11 vintage. The pour is carmel with little head. The aroma is strong toffee. Te taste is strong toffee and almost burnt. I get no barrel at all. A little disappointed. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma of toffee, caramel, and dark fruits.  Pours deep brown with root beer head. Taste is delicious with syrup, toffee, pecans, and molasses.  Very sticky.  Cool barleywine.
Very nice, enjoyed alongside an GI Icarus and the brilliance of the malts in thsi one were great.
Had after zwanze day, was 2009 perfect storm. Overall this beer was too thin for  me with a veryy hot dominating boozy wood. i was disapointed in how this withstood the aging process.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2015 2012 bomber from trade with michaelinwa.  Big want knocked off.  Pours a very dark mahogany color with a small beige head that fades quickly.  Huge aroma of bourbon, maple syrup, caramel, toffee, alcohol, and vanilla.  Taste is syrupy sweet and very smooth.  Great balance of flavors with the bourbon standing out just a tad.  Finish has a very slight alcohol heat which is nice.  Bourbon, caramel and vanilla lingers.  Thick, chewy and sticky mouthfeel.  Really nice sipping beer for the winter.  If I get another I will most likely lay it down for a bit.  Could improve with age.  Re-rate 4/8/15 - Another 2012 bomber shared by mrebeks this time.  Bottle is over 2 years old now.  Even better than before.  So much rich caramel and toffee candy in the aroma and in the taste.  Bourbon booze has faded away leaving rich candy flavors with vanilla, oak, and light chocolate.  Love this beer.
En botella cortersia de bernatbeer & eric.aromas a piña caramelo, barrica y cacao. Sabor intenso y complejo.un birrote

Bomber procured from the Cookster (thanks, Jason. Ill get your money to ya soon). Pours a dark brown, nearly opaque with a tan head that had decent retention and okay lacing. Nose is malty, barrel, some toffee. Mouth is full bodied and creamy, some booziness, milk chocolate, malts, dried fruit, a bit of an alkaline finish that wasnt attractive, but overall a decent brew... particularly on a late January night with the wind howling and the mercury falling like a rock.

Pours a clear looking dark brown, almost black. Strong aromas of bourbon, booze, barrel.  Peaty taste, roasted malts, booze bottles, American bourbon, backcountry moon shiners, Kentucky. West Virginia. Bootlegging. Coal mines. This is over the top boozy and heavy. Good, but probably wont seek out again.

2011 Vintage: A: Mollasses, cherr, wood, bourbon, nuts and hints of vanilla. P: Black with reddish and brownish highlights and a minimal head. T: Wood, alcohol, heavy malt, nuts and vanilla. M: thin with some light carbonation, goes down warm. O: Not much to say but I think I wont be hunting down this one again.
Dark ruby, beige lacing, Heavy bourbon on the nose. Malty, vanilla, cocao, wood. Burn on the backend. Smooth.

651mL 2011ed thanks to dreadnaught33. Pours a clear, deep amber with yellowish/golden foam. Weak formation and retention. Nose is golden raisin, rum, brown sugar, tomato, Twizzlers. Taste is paper, cardboard, harsh acid, butyric/stomach bile. Palate has paper, oil, peppercorn.

Bottle 22oz [2011]
Pours dark brown with reddish reflects. Aroma is of malt, fruits, bread, alcohol, bourbon. Taste is Scotch Ale reminescent (malt-wise), alcohol, bourbon. Palate: Full bodied. Sticky texture. Overall: Heavy on sugar. Weird malt profile (imvho). Still pretty good indeed.

Bottle shared by David, thanks man! Not sure of the vintage but lets say it is from 2011 (I believe it would have been said if it were older). I didnt take much notes but I will say that this is a really great beer that I wouldnt get bored of drinking and is on par with CCB Leon, GI King Henry and every world class barleywines! I do remember it being a little more intense on the barrel aromas and flavors though.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2013 4th June 20112011 Bottle. Opaque dark brown beer, pale tan head. Sweetish bourbon nose. Crispy palate, semi dry. Rich chocolatey malt and bourbon. Alcohol heat. Minerals. Vanilla oak sweetness. Overall a huge beer but the palate is light and crisp. Good but should have left it for a year or three! 8th September 20112010 bottle at 13.0%. Palate is crisp and comparatively light. Semi dry. Nice coconut, mildly toasted. Trace of vanilla. A little dark chocolate liquer. Aniseed and brandy alcohol. A bit less aggressive than then 2011.

Bottle (22 oz). Vintage 2011. Shared by David, huge thanks! Reddish brown with no head and no lacing. Aroma is boozy with bourbon, caramel, malt, vanilla, wood, molasses. Taste is about the same but stronger and more complex. Heavily sweet, but not cloying (I easily drank 1/4 of the bottle). Medium to heavy body. Very good Barley Wine. Really complex and well balanced despite the heavy sweetness. We tasted it after CCB Leon and GI King Henry and, in my opinion, this one is a step behind.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2013 (cuvée 2011): Grosse tempête bourbonnée, caramel intense!! Le corps est plus soutenu que la sucaba mais moins complexe, lage devrait lui être bénéfique.. Exactement ce que je mattendais.

Big time dark fruits/raisin aromas with wood and sweet caramel. Taste is a lot of wood and finishes with a sweet caramel and big alcohol bite. Would like to try an aged one, a bit hot.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22oz bottle that I picked up from the brewpub. 2012 Vintage. Pours a deep brown colored body with a finger-width, creamy, brown head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is really nice with deep caramels and toffee while being well hopped with some orange citruses. Nice bourbon and oak element with some vanilla, raisins, dates, prunes, dark fruits, and touches of toasted coconut. Flavor is similar. Richer caramels and toffees up front with a nice vanilla and toasty coconut. Hops come on in the middle with some orange citruses as well as the plethora of dried dark fruits. More oak and some bourbon towards the end as this gets a bit nutty and more toasty before finishing mostly dry and clean with a nice balance between the malts, hops, and barrel. Lengthy aftertaste following a medium-full body and a soft, light carbonation. Overall, a really awesome barely wine. Malty and sweet, toasty, well hopped, fruity, and not overdone on the barrel aging. Excellent.

2011 Bomber from BigTomZ. Nose is tons of prunes and golden raisins, toffee, chocolate, and a hint of vanilla. Dark cherry brown with a big heavy lacing beige head. Flavor is lightly sweet, very dark fruity with bigtime toffee.

2012. Pours much darker than every previous year of MoaS, very dark brown with way more head than any previous year. Caramely aroma, strongly malty, a kiss of dark fruits to round things out.

Black licorice and molasses join the caramel train across my palate. Meadows of malts are a safe haven for all things barleywine-y. The 2012 is a clear departure from previous vintages of MoaS, and I like what they've done with the place. Excited to see how this develops with age.

2009 bottle.  Nice caramel and fairly hoppy aroma with just traces of bourbon.  Palate is chewy with plenty of caramel, lesser raisin, hop bitterness persists with the alcohol bite, fairly toasty.  Nice bit of brewing.

Bottle at 16 Tons, Eugene. Wow. So much going on here. Pours a reddish brown, slight tan head. Aroma is rich, malty and nice but not amazing. Taste is another story altogether. Barrels, booze, sweetness, vanilla, cherries, a whole lot of stuff. Maybe the most complex beer Ive tasted to this point. Price is a bit of an object, but I would open a bottle to share any day.

Bottle at THE Barley Wine Tasting, London. Vintage 2011, thanks to Bruce! Pours black-red with a moderate, beige foam head. Sweet malt nose with rich, toasted caramel, dark fruits. Hugely sweet flavor with lots of dark malts, light cocoa, modest booze, prunes, sticky brown sugar, toffee, mild tangy berries, dark toast, figs. Full bodied with fine to average carbonation. Warming finish with some faintly dry cocoa, loads of boozy fruits, prunes and figs, dark bread. Great nuance, good balance. Wonderful.

At last, a barleywine I prefer even over Olde Curmudgeon!
2012 Bottling
Incredibly complex nose and flavor of caramel, toffee, bourbon (lots of it), sherry, cognac,  vanilla, oak, raisins, honey, kumquats, orange zest, persimmons, plums, peaches, strawberries, prunes, dates, figs, cherries, pecan pralines, rhubarb, toasted coconut, leather, tobacco, and a hint of smokiness.

The body is syrupy, but playfully so, not sticky or cloying. This beauty has legs like Angelina, and the mouth becomes delightfully coated as the sipping continues. The finish is one of the longest Ive ever experienced, and the woodiness and the alcohol prevent this one from becoming too sweet (as a gentleman before me pointed out).

Its been quite a few years since I was an ardent fan of the barleywine style, but this one absolutely blew me away, even fresh. I can only imagine what a few years of aging might achieve.

Pours a deep, reddish brown, with a moderate, lose, disappearing head. Aroma is sweet malt, primarily, with some subtle notes of toffee, carmel, raisin and vanilla. Aroma is bit too heavy on the malt, but Im being picky, because this is a pricey beer. I do not get more than, maybe, a hint of bourbon or oak in the aroma. The taste is dominantly sweet malt, brown sugar, substantial alcohol component, and really just hints of toffee, bourbon and oak. The mouthfeel is smooth and the carbonation is moderate. I find this beer to be enjoyable, but given the ABV and the barrel aging, I would have expected more complexity and depth. So, while Im happy to have tried it, it will probably be a while before I come back to it. As for aging, my concern is that it will lose some of the complexity it has, which for me would not be a plus.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2015 22oz bottle from Belmont Station. Split 2 ways. Snifter.A: Dark brackish brown with tints of red. No head after an aggressive pour.N: Malt, licorice, caramel, and toffee. Brown sugar. Has an inviting nose. Bourbon, vanilla, coconut, and oak are present, subtly. Biscuity sweetness. Quite nice.T: Very sweet. Loads of brown sugar, toffee, and licorice. The bourbon goodness of the nose is very muted. There is some oak, but it?s very light. Does become cloying. Wish this matched the nose.M: Thick and sticky. Coats the palate.O: Glad this is distributed, because I definitely don?t need more than one. Needs a ton more bourbon, otherwise it doesn?t justify the cost increase over winterfest or even the wee heavy.

Cellar update: I am now drinking the 2009. It has all of the above elements and more of the bourbon. I would rate the 2009 closer to 3.9.

2011 Bottle. Pours a nice dark red color with a beige head. Aroma is of bourbon, charred oak, vanilla, coconut, molasses, winegums, toasted notes, breadiness, brown sugar, dark fruits and alcohol. Flavor follows the nose, lots of barrel character, bourbon soaked raisins, bourbon, charred oak, vanilla, coconut, dark fruits, alcohol, brown sugar, breadiness, toasted nuts, winegums and molasses. The body is full with a sticky and oily mouth feel. Overall a great Barley Wine!

Bottle, 2011 release, 11/28/2012. Pours deep brown, ruby highlights, thin yet dense cream tan-colored head, thin ring of viscous lacing. Aroma of caramel and toffee fudge, dark grained bread, sweet dark fruit, almost candied, vanilla and smooth bourbon notes, boozy edge to the finish. Taste follows suit, with rich malty base of caramel, dark bread, sweet chocolate fudge, vanilla toffee bread pudding, bourbon, nice hoppy bitterness with a hot finish. Full body, rich and chewy.  This is pretty smooth at one year compared to fresher samples. Very tasty.

Bottle. Small beige head on a clear redbrown beer. Nice aroma of bourbon/wood, alcohol, resins, cherry, marmelade, malt/molasses/nougat. Most of that comes back in the taste which also has something slight peppery.
